results.title: Effects of losartan or atenolol in hypertensive patients without clinically evident vascular disease: a substudy of the LIFE randomized trial.
results.text_hl: Effects of @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ in @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ without clinically evident @<m>DISEASE_Vascular_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014652 @@@vascular disease@@@: a substudy of the LIFE randomized trial.

results.title: Effect of chronic atenolol therapy on the cardiovascular response to handgrip in hypertensive patients.
results.text_hl: The treatment did not prevent or attenuate the rise in heart rate with grip, but it partially inhibited the pressor response to handgrip. Chronic @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ therapy may reduce the risk of @<m>DISEASE_Vascular_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014652 @@@vascular disease@@@ by decreasing blood pressure and its response to isometric exercise.

citations.NLM: Orlandi C, Fogari R. Effect of chronic atenolol therapy on the cardiovascular response to handgrip in hypertensive patients. Clin Ther. 1983;5(6):632-7. PMID: 6627289
citations.BibTeX: @article{6627289, title={Effect of chronic atenolol therapy on the cardiovascular response to handgrip in hypertensive patients.}, author={Orlandi C and Fogari R}, journal={Clin Ther}, volume={5}, number={6}, pages={632-7}}

results.title: Comprehensive Assessment of Coronary Plaque Progression With Advanced Intravascular Imaging, Physiological Measures, and Wall Shear Stress: A Pilot Double-Blinded Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial of Nebivolol Versus Atenolol in Nonobstructive Coronary Artery Disease
results.text_hl: We hypothesized that @CHEMICAL_Nebivolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068577 @@@nebivolol@@@, a beta-blocker with @CHEMICAL_Nitric_Oxide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009569 @@@nitric oxide@@@-mediated activity, compared with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, a beta-blocker without such activity, would decrease oxidative stress and improve the effects of @<m>DISEASE_Vascular_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014652 @@@endothelial dysfunction@@@ and wall shear stress (WSS), thereby reducing @DISEASE_Atherosclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D050197 @@@atherosclerosis@@@ progression and vulnerability in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with nonobstructive @DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@coronary artery disease@@@.

citations.NLM: Hung OY, Molony D, Corban MT, Rasoul-Arzrumly E, Maynard C, Eshtehardi P, Dhawan S, Timmins LH, Piccinelli M, Ahn SG, Gogas BD, McDaniel MC, Quyyumi AA, Giddens DP, Samady H. Comprehensive Assessment of Coronary Plaque Progression With Advanced Intravascular Imaging, Physiological Measures, and Wall Shear Stress: A Pilot Double-Blinded Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial of Nebivolol Versus Atenolol in Nonobstructive Coronary Artery Disease J Am Heart Assoc. 2016 Jan 25;5(1):. PMID: 26811165
citations.BibTeX: @article{26811165, title={Comprehensive Assessment of Coronary Plaque Progression With Advanced Intravascular Imaging, Physiological Measures, and Wall Shear Stress: A Pilot Double-Blinded Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial of Nebivolol Versus Atenolol in Nonobstructive Coronary Artery Disease}, author={Hung OY and Molony D and Corban MT and Rasoul-Arzrumly E and Maynard C and Eshtehardi P and Dhawan S and Timmins LH and Piccinelli M and Ahn SG and Gogas BD and McDaniel MC and Quyyumi AA and Giddens DP and Samady H}, journal={J Am Heart Assoc}, volume={5}, number={1}}

results.title: Effect of nebivolol and atenolol on brachial artery flow-mediated vasodilation in patients with coronary artery disease.
results.text_hl: No significant differences were observed between the two groups at baseline in FMD. In the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ group FMD remained unchanged at the end of the 4-week treatment, but in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ treated with @CHEMICAL_Nebivolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068577 @@@nebivolol@@@ FMD showed a significant increase by the end of the treatment period (3.9 +/- 2.7% vs. 5.6 +/- 2.9%, p = 0.047) leading to a significantly higher value compared to @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (5.6 +/- 2.9% vs. 3.4 +/- 3.2%, p = 0.041).Beta(1) blockade by @CHEMICAL_Nebivolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068577 @@@nebivolol@@@ but not @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ improves @<m>DISEASE_Vascular_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014652 @@@endothelial dysfunction@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@CAD@@@, an effect that might further reduce the risk for cardiovascular events in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@CAD@@@.

citations.NLM: Lekakis JP, Protogerou A, Papamichael C, Vamvakou G, Ikonomidis I, Fici F, Mavrikakis M. Effect of nebivolol and atenolol on brachial artery flow-mediated vasodilation in patients with coronary artery disease. Cardiovasc Drugs Ther. 2005 Aug;19(4):277-81. PMID: 16187009

results.title: Inhibition of platelet aggregation in whole blood by adrenoceptor antagonists.
results.text_hl: The anti-platelet effect of these drugs may be of value in the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Vascular_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014652 @@@vascular disease@@@.
